title: Gama for whom: Verdict today
byline: Sri Lankan voters will go to the polls today to elect members to 339 local authorities, the first of its kind to be held since 2018.

title: Gun violence continues unabated with 28 shot dead
byline: A rise in shootings linked to the underworld and drug trafficking continues to alarm the public, with the latest incident in Mount Lavinia adding to growing concerns over safety.

title: NA Chairman hosts Sri Lankan President
byline: National Assembly (NA) Chairman Trần Thanh Mẫn met with Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka in Hà Nội on Monday during the latter’s ongoing state visit to Việt Nam and participation in the UN Day of Vesak Celebrations 2025.

title: Pakistan tests missile, India orders drills amid Kashmir standoff
byline: Pakistan carried out a second missile test in three days on Monday and India said it ordered several states to conduct security drills, as fears mounted the neighbours could be heading to a confrontation over a deadly attack in Kashmir.

title: Ukraine drone attack shuts Moscow airports, says Russia
byline: Russia says Ukraine has launched an overnight drone attack targeting Moscow for the second night in a row.

title: SL’s financial sector faces over US $ 10bn climate bill
byline: Sri Lanka’s financial sector must gear up to mobilise an estimated US $ 10.85 billion by 2030 to meet the country’s climate commitments, the Central Bank said, while warning that the cost of inaction is rising as climate risks intensify.

title: J’pura University student arrested over assaulting fellow student
byline: A student of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura was taken into custody yesterday morning by the Homagama police, following investigations into a complaint of causing grievous injuries to a fellow student.

title: Committee appointed to probe Excise vehicle misuse case
byline: A three-member committee has been appointed to probe a vehicle misuse case within the Department of Excise.

title: Two more Sabaragamuwa University students arrested over ragging incident
byline: Two more students from the Faculty of Engineering Technology at the Sabaragamuwa University have been arrested over the ongoing investigations into a ragging incident.

title: Police probe foiled abduction near girls’ school in Colombo
byline: The Cinnamon Gardens Police have launched an investigation into an attempted abduction near a leading girls’ school in Colombo, police said.

title: Police seek public assistance to locate murder suspect
byline: Police has sought public assistance to locate the suspect who is wanted for the murder of two persons at Liyanagemulla, Seeduwa in December last year.

title: CBSL launches Sustainable Finance Roadmap 2.0
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) launched the Sustainable Finance Roadmap 2.0 yesterday (5 April), marking a key milestone in its continued efforts to foster a climate-resilient and socially inclusive financial system.

title: SLC brings in  ex-India coach to lead fielding camp in Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket said that former India national team fielding coach R. Sridhar will conduct a comprehensive 10-day fielding program aimed at elevating the standards of Sri Lankan cricketers.

title: Court relaxes bail conditions for ex-Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, others
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Harshana Kekunawela today ordered the relaxation of bail conditions imposed on former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and three others, who were previously arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and later released on bail.

title: Namal urges swift action over Kotahena schoolgirl’s death
byline: MP Namal Rajapaksa said today that they are closely following the case of the schoolgirl who committed suicide in Kotahena recently and urged Education Minister Harini Amarasuriya to act swiftly, regardless of any connections.

title: Man injured in police shooting at Seeduwa
byline: A man was injured in a police shooting this morning in the 18th Post area of Katunayake after he allegedly attacked a police officer with a sharp weapon.

title: Probe launched after man jailed for ringing phone dies in custody
byline: The Angunukolapelessa Police have launched an investigation following the death of a 46-year-old man who was jailed after his mobile phone rang during court proceedings.

title: New Zealand PM proposes banning under-16s from social media
byline: New Zealand’s prime minister on Tuesday (May 6) proposed banning children under 16 from social media, stressing the need to shield them from the perils of big tech platforms.

title: Voter turnout 20 percent in several districts
byline: Voter turnout for the Local Government elections 2025 was 20 percent in several districts as of 10 a.m. today.

title: SLBFE manager, 5 others suspended in Rs. 250 million scam
byline: The services of six individuals, including an Additional General Manager of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), were suspended with immediate effect from yesterday (5) over an alleged financial fraud of approximately Rs. 250 million.

title: Cop shoots himself at Padiyathalawa Police station
byline: A 59-year-old police constable attached to the Padiyathalawa Police Station in Ampara has reportedly committed suicide by shooting himself with his service firearm early this morning.

title: World Bank Group President to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Ajay Banga will visit Sri Lanka on Wednesday, May 7, the first presidential visit to the country by a World Bank Group president in nearly 20 years.

title: PM Harini responds to alleged election law violation
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya stated that she will respect any action taken by the Election Commission if her recent remarks in Moratuwa are deemed a violation of the Election Law.

title: Voting for LG polls concludes
byline: Voting for the the Local Government elections 2025 was officially concluded at 4.00 p.m. today.

title: Man falls to death while trying to steal gem from Seenigama Devala statue
byline: A man who tried to remove a precious stone fixed on the forehead of Devol Deviyo (deity) of ancient Seenigama Maha Devalaya, which is situated on an offshore islet in Seenigama, collapsed to his death last night.

title: Dubai driver with double flavoured fags worth Rs. 4.4 Mn nabbed at BIA
byline: A Sri Lankan expatriate worker returning from Dubai was arrested by the Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) today for smuggling in a consignment of special double flavoured cigarettes worth over Rs. 4.4 million.

title: NCPA launches probe into Kotahena school girl’s death
byline: The National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) has launched an investigation into the incident where a schoolgirl committed suicide in Kotahena recently.

title: CSE wraps up the shortened trading session with improved momentum
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its positive momentum from yesterday, with the All-Share Price Index (ASPI) closing above the 15,900 mark once again.

title: Minor violations of election laws: PAFFREL
byline: There have been minor incidents of violating election laws such as campaigning in a few places in the country today, PAFFREL Executive Director Rohana Hettiarachchi said.

title: All mobile phone signals deactivated ahead of conclave to elect next Pope
byline: Ahead of the secretive conclave to elect the next pope, all mobile phone signals will be deactivated in the Vatican on Wednesday. The Vatican also plans to use signal jammers around the Sistine Chapel to stop electronic surveillance or communication outside the conclave, where 133 cardinals vote to decide who will be succeeding Pope Francis.

title: Voter turnout 40 percent in most districts
byline: Voter turnout for the Local Government elections 2025 was over 40 percent in most of the districts as of 2 p.m. today.

title: President returns
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake returned to the country this afternoon after concluding his official visit to Vietnam.

title: NPP wins Hambantota Pradeshiya Sabha and Hikkaduwa Urban Council
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has recorded  victories in the both the Hambantota Pradeshiya Sabha and the Hikkaduwa Urban Council.

title: Police fire warning shot in Matugama
byline: A police officer assigned to provide security to a residence near Athulathmudali Maha Vidyalaya in Matugama fired a warning shot into the air this evening, police said.

title: SJB candidate stabbed at Dikwella Kanda in Deraniyagala
byline: A Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) candidate contesting for the Deraniyagala Pradeshiya Sabha was hospitalised after having been stabbed by an unidenfied person at Dikwella Kanda today, the Campaign for Free and Fair Elections (CAFE) said today.

title: NPP secures victory in Wattegama Urban Council
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has emerged victorious in the Wattegama Urban Council election earning eight seats in the council.

title: NPP wins seven seats at Balangoda UC
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has claimed victory in the Balangoda Urban Council in the Ratnapura District, obtaining 4,833 votes and securing seven seats.

title: US Defense Secretary Hegseth orders 20% cut in senior ranks of military
byline: United States Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth has announced steep cuts in the number of top-ranked officers in his latest move to streamline the world’s most powerful military.

title: ITAK gains victory in Manthai East PS
byline: The Illankai Tamil Arasu Kadchi (ITAK) has claimed victory in the Manthai East Pradeshiya Sabha in the Mullaitivu District.

title: Three former presidents fail to vote at LG Poll
byline: Former Presidents Mahinda Rajapaksa, Gotabaya Rajapaksa and Maithripala Sirisena did not cast their votes at today’s Local Government Election.

title: Ambalangoda Urban Council too goes to NPP
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has claimed victory in the Ambalangoda Urban Council election in the Galle District.

title: NPP wins Hambantota Municipal Council
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has emerged victorious in the Hambantota Municipal Council election.

title: Independent Group claims victory in Haputale Urban Council
byline: Independent Group 1 has won the Haputale Urban Council in the Badulla District, according to official results.

title: India steps in to stop Sotheby’s auction of sacred Buddhist relics
byline: After being served a legal notice by the Ministry of Culture on Monday evening, international auction house Sothebys has assured the Indian government that it will take adequate measures to prevent the auction of sacred Buddhist relics at its upcoming auction on May 7.

title: First results of LG poll released: NPP wins
byline: The Election Commission has released the first results of the 2025 Local Government Election.

title: First LG body result after 8.00pm: ECSL
byline: With the conclusion of voting of the Local Government Elections 2025 at 4.00pm today the Election Commission of Sri Lanka said there is a possibility to issue the first official results of two to three LG bodies after 8.00pm tonight.

title: Voter turnout exceeds 60% in Kalutara, 50% in Colombo
byline: Voter turnout in the Kalutara and Colombo districts for the 2025 Local Government Elections has surpassed 60% and 50% respectively, as of 4 p.m., according to official data.

title: President confident of successful election results
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today he was confident that they will get successful results in the Local Government elections.

title: SL ranks 89 in latest Human Development Index
byline: Sri Lanka is ranked 89 in the latest Human Development Index (HDI), the UN Development Programme (UNDP) said on Tuesday.

title: CID summons Tusitha Halloluwa over defamation of President
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has summoned former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board, Tusitha Halloluwa to record a statement over the alleged defamatory and false statement made regarding President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Another misidentification of Ishara Sewwandi
byline: In another misidentification of Ishara Sewwandi, who is wanted over the murder of Ganemulle Sanjeewa at the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, a woman bearing the same name has been arrested today by the Kuliyapitiya police.
